creator: michael@quickstream.com
text:
The jar task is wrapping long lines (over 71 chars) in my manifest file.
This causes problems with weblogic 6.1 sp2.

The manifest is inside of a JAR located in WEB-INF/lib in my WAR.

Short report of the log file (partial stacktrace) -
java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1
	at java.lang.String.substring(String.java:1525)
	at weblogic.utils.jars.ManifestEntry.stream(ManifestEntry.java:166)
	at weblogic.utils.jars.Manifest.stream(Manifest.java:81)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.WebAppHelper.resolveManifestName
(WebAppHelper.java:398)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.WebAppHelper.extractClassFiles
(WebAppHelper.java:177)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.WebAppServletContext.extractClassFiles
(WebAppServletContext.java:3405)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.WebAppServletContext.setDocroot
(WebAppServletContext.java:3376)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.WebAppServletContext.init
(WebAppServletContext.java:862)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.WebAppServletContext.<init>
(WebAppServletContext.java:815)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.HttpServer.loadWebApp(HttpServer.java:428)
	at weblogic.j2ee.WebAppComponent.deploy(WebAppComponent.java:74)
	at weblogic.j2ee.Application.deploy(Application.java:260)
	at weblogic.j2ee.J2EEService.deployApplication(J2EEService.java:185)

creator: michael@quickstream.com
text:
My mistake.
Further investigation revealed that wrapping is correct.
Is a Weblogic 6.1 issue - Revealed on sp2 and not sp1.
Please close this bug.
